name: infra
info: Railway network topology and topography, position wrt topology, location on a map, geometry, aka. alignment

enums.name: Direction
enums.info: List of applicable usage directions with respect to Track Edge e. g. for restrictions

enumLiterals.name: dirSame
enumLiterals.info: Applicable in the same direction as TrackEdge

enumLiterals.name: dirReverse
enumLiterals.info: Applicable in the opposite direction of the TrackEdge (from end to start)

enums.name: LoadingGaugeType
enums.info: is coming from ETCS packets 11,12 mLoadingGauge

enumLiterals.name: loadingGaugeIncompatible
enumLiterals.info: The train does not fit to any of the interoperable loading gauge profiles

enumLiterals.name: powerlessMainSwitch
enumLiterals.info: Powerless section, switch off main power switch

enumLiterals.name: bigMetalMasses
enumLiterals.info: Big metal masses, ignore on-board integrity check alarm of balise transmission

enumLiterals.name: radioHole
enumLiterals.info: stop supervision of the loss of safe radio connection

enumLiterals.name: switchOffRegenerativeBrake
enumLiterals.info: defines a switch Off Regenerative Brake sections

enumLiterals.name: switchOffEddyCurrentBrakeForServiceBrake
enumLiterals.info: defines a switch Off Eddy Current Brake sections

enumLiterals.name: switchOffEddyCurrentBrakeForEmergencyBrake
enumLiterals.info: defines a switch Off Eddy Current Emergency Brake sections

enumLiterals.name: switchOffMagneticShoeBrake
enumLiterals.info: defines a switch Off Magnetic Shoe Brake sections

enumLiterals.name: vtNotFitted
enumLiterals.info: Line not fitted (not electrified) with any traction system

enumLiterals.name: tgUnknown
enumLiterals.info: Line not fitted (not electrified) with any traction system

enums.name: TrainEndApplicability
enums.info: List of train end applicability types

enumLiterals.name: lengthDelay
enumLiterals.info: Train length delay on validity end point of profile element

enumLiterals.name: noLengthDelay
enumLiterals.info: No Train length delay on validity end point of profile element.

enums.name: OtherSpecificStaticSpeedProfileCategory
enums.info: List of other specific static speed profile categories

enumLiterals.name: SSSP_freightTrainP
enumLiterals.info: Other SSSP applies to Freight train of type P

enumLiterals.name: SSSP_freightTrainG
enumLiterals.info: Other SSSP applies to Freight train of type G

enumLiterals.name: SSSP_passengerTrain
enumLiterals.info: Other SSSP applies to Passenger train

enums.name: CantDeficiencyCategory
enums.info: List of cant deficiency speed profile categories

enumLiterals.info: Applicable for trains capable of compensating cant deficiency of 80mm

enumLiterals.info: Applicable for trains capable of compensating cant deficiency of 100mm

enumLiterals.name: CD_130mm

enumLiterals.info: Applicable for trains capable of compensating cant deficiency of 180mm

enumLiterals.name: CD_225mm
enumLiterals.info: Applicable for trains capable of compensating cant deficiency of 225mm

enumLiterals.name: CD_245mm
enumLiterals.info: Applicable for trains capable of compensating cant deficiency of 245mm

enumLiterals.name: CD_275mm
enumLiterals.info: Applicable for trains capable of compensating cant deficiency of 275mm

enumLiterals.name: CD_300mm
enumLiterals.info: Applicable for trains capable of compensating cant deficiency of 300mm

enumLiterals.name: AL_A
enumLiterals.info: Applicable for trains falling under axle load category A

enumLiterals.info: doors do not open in any side

structs.name: TopoArea
structs.info: Defines a container for rail network topology

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: versionTimestamp
attrs.info: version information which is valid since timestamp

attrs.name: trackEdges
attrs.info: composes of track edges

attrs.name: trackEdgeLinks
attrs.info: composes of track edge links

structs.name: TrackEdge
structs.info: A track edge is an uninterrupted stretch of railway track, without divergence or convergence.

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: trackEdgeLength
attrs.info: Distance along the TrackEdge's track centre line.

structs.name: TrackEdgeLink
structs.info: Defines a relation between two track edges along which a train can run.

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: trackEdgeA
attrs.info: Connects to track edge A

attrs.name: trackEdgeB
attrs.info: Connects to track edge B

attrs.name: startOfA
attrs.info: True when linked to the start of track edge A, false when to the end

attrs.name: startOfB
attrs.info: True when linked to the start of track edge B, false when to the end

structs.name: TrackEdgePoint
structs.info: Defines a non-directed spot location (without spatial expansion) on a Track Edge

attrs.name: trackEdge
attrs.info: is positioned on track edge

attrs.name: pos
attrs.info: position on the associated Track Edge

structs.name: DirTrackEdgePoint
structs.info: Defines a directed spot location (without spatial expansion) on a Track Edge

attrs.name: trackEdge
attrs.info: refers to track edge

attrs.name: pos
attrs.info: position on the associated Track Edge

attrs.name: sameDir
attrs.info: usage direction of the TrackEdge ;true: active in same direction as trackEdge, false: active in opposite direction

structs.name: TrackEdgeSection
structs.info: Defines a non-directed linear object (with a linear extension) located on a Track Edge

attrs.name: trackEdge
attrs.info: refers to track edge

attrs.name: skipFromStart
attrs.info: ignore section [0..skipFromStart].

attrs.name: skipFromEnd
attrs.info: ignore section [skipFromEnd, length].

structs.name: DirTrackEdgeSection
structs.info: Defines a directed linear object (with a linear extension) located on a Track Edge

attrs.name: trackEdge
attrs.info: refers totrack edge

attrs.name: skipFromStart
attrs.info: ignore section [0..skipFromStart]

attrs.name: skipFromEnd
attrs.info: ignore section [skipFromEnd, length]

attrs.name: applicableDirection
attrs.info: defines the applicable direction of the track edge

attrs.name: trackEdge
attrs.info: refers totrack edge

attrs.name: sameDir
attrs.info: usage direction of the TrackEdge ;true: active in same direction as trackEdge, false: active in opposite direction

structs.name: LinkedPath
structs.info: Defines a linked path on the topology

attrs.name: dirTrackEdges
attrs.info: composes of directed track edges

attrs.name: skipFromPathStart
attrs.info: ignore section [0..skipFromStart]

attrs.name: skipFromPathEnd
attrs.info: ignore section [skipFromEnd, length]

structs.name: TrackArea
structs.info: Defines a Track Area on the topology

attrs.name: trackEdgeSections
attrs.info: composes of track edge sections

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: versionTimestamp
attrs.info: version information which is valid since timestamp

attrs.name: alignment3d
attrs.info: if true, all positions and length calculated on 3d line. if false - on 2d projection

attrs.name: trackEdgeGeometries
attrs.info: composes of track edge geometries

structs.name: TrackEdgeGeometry
structs.info: Defines the geometry of the track edge centre line as a list of parametrised curves. The geometry is smooth; no discontinuities in azimuth or inclination.

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: horizontalAlignment
attrs.info: Sequence of geometric primitives, i.e. arc, line or clothoid, that compose this track geometry

attrs.name: verticalAlignment
attrs.info: Sequence of geometric primitives, i.e. arc, line or clothoid, that compose this track geometry

attrs.name: cantPoints
attrs.info: trackEdge must be completely defined, at least at beginning and end. Empty means undefined

structs.name: HorizontalSegment
structs.info: A curvi-linear geometric primitive, mathematically represents a horizontal segment of the centre line of a railway track

attrs.name: horizontalSegmentLine
attrs.info: composes of lines

attrs.name: horizontalSegmentArc
attrs.info: composes of arcs

attrs.name: horizontalSegmentTransition
attrs.info: composes of transition curves

structs.name: HorizontalLine
structs.info: Geometric primitive for a horizontal linear segment

attrs.name: trackGeometryPos
attrs.info: position on the associated Track Edge

attrs.name: azimuth
attrs.info: The azimuth at pos, i.e. bearing measured clockwise with respect to geographic north

structs.name: HorizontalArc
structs.info: Geometric primitive for a horizontal arc of circle

attrs.name: trackGeometryPos
attrs.info: position on the associated Track Edge

attrs.name: azimuth
attrs.info: The azimuth at pos, i.e. bearing measured clockwise with respect to geographic north

attrs.name: radius
attrs.info: radius at pos, negative-counter-clockwise/left-curve, positive-clockwise/right-curve

structs.name: HorizontalTransition
structs.info: Geometric primitive for a horizontal transition curve, a clothoid.

attrs.name: trackGeometryPos
attrs.info: position on the associated Track Edge

attrs.name: azimuth
attrs.info: The azimuth at pos, i.e. bearing measured clockwise with respect to geographic north

attrs.name: radius
attrs.info: radius at pos, negative-counter-clockwise/left-curve, positive-clockwise/right-curve

attrs.name: transitionType
attrs.info: defines different transition types

structs.name: VerticalSegment
structs.info: A curvi-linear geometric primitive, mathematically represents a vertical segment of the centre line of a railway track

attrs.name: verticalSegmentLine
attrs.info: composes of lines

attrs.name: verticalSegmentArc
attrs.info: composes of arcs

structs.name: VerticalLine
structs.info: Geometric primitive for vertical linear segment

attrs.name: trackGeometryPos
attrs.info: position on the associated Track Edge

attrs.name: slope
attrs.info: The vertical slope at pos, between the horizon and the track centre line. Viewed in the direction of the track edge. Positive for rising slope and negative for falling slope.

structs.name: VerticalArc
structs.info: Geometric primitive for a vertical arc.

attrs.name: trackGeometryPos
attrs.info: position on the associated Track Edge

attrs.name: slope
attrs.info: The vertical slope at pos, between the horizon and the track centre line. Viewed in the direction of the track edge. Positive for rising slope and negative for falling slope.

attrs.name: radius
attrs.info: radius at pos, negative-counter-clockwise/sag-curve, positive-clockwise/crest-curve

structs.name: CantPoint
structs.info: Cant at a given location on the track.

attrs.name: trackGeometryPos
attrs.info: position on the associated track edge

attrs.name: appliedCant
attrs.info: Height of the right rail minus the left rail. Right/left with respect to the direction of the track edge. Rollangle=(arcsin(cant/gauge)), gauge is distance between middle of the railheads, e.g. 1500mm for EU-standard gauge '1435mm'

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: versionTimestamp
attrs.info: version information which is valid since timestamp

attrs.name: sampledTrackEdgeGeometries
attrs.info: composes of sampled track edge geometries

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: slopes
attrs.info: composes of slope sample points

attrs.name: curves
attrs.info: composes of curve sample points

attrs.name: cants
attrs.info: composes of cant sample points

structs.name: SlopeSamplePoint
structs.info: Slope (gradient) of the track at a given location on the track.

attrs.name: pos
attrs.info: position on the associated TrackEdge

attrs.name: samplePointSlope
attrs.info: The vertical slope at pos, between the horizon and the track centre line. Viewed in the direction of the track edge. Positive for rising slope and negative for falling slope.

structs.name: CantSamplePoint
structs.info: Cant(superelevation) of the track at a given location on the track.

attrs.name: pos
attrs.info: position on the associated TrackEdge

attrs.name: samplePointCant
attrs.info: Defines appliedCant as the Height of the right rail minus the left rail. Right/left with respect to the direction of the track edge. Rollangle=(arcsin(cant/gauge), gauge is distance between centers of rail-heads, e.g. 1500mm for EU-standard gauge.

structs.name: CurveSamplePoint
structs.info: Curve (radius) of the track at a given location on the track.

attrs.name: pos
attrs.info: position on the associated TrackEdge

attrs.name: sampleCurveRadius
attrs.info: radius at pos, negative-counter-clockwise/left-curve, positive-clockwise/right-curve

structs.name: SimplePoint
structs.info: Defines the physical track asset Simple Point

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing ; structure refers to EULYNX EU.SAS.77

attrs.name: reversalTime
attrs.info: Defines the time in seconds to switch from one position to the other ; 0 means unknown

attrs.name: pointLeft
attrs.info: Track Edge Link referencing the left side of the point in the facing direction of the simple point

attrs.name: pointRight
attrs.info: Track Edge Link referencing the right side of the point in the facing direction of the simple point

structs.name: SlipCrossing
structs.info: Defines the physical track asset Slip Crossing ; 2 instances simple point define a single slip crossing and 4 instances of simple point defined a double slip crossing ; Reversal time is the maximum of reversal times of simple points

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: simplePoints
attrs.info: Consists of simple points

attrs.name: crossing
attrs.info: Consists of crossing

structs.name: Derailer
structs.info: Defines the physical track asset Derailer

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: dirSpotLocation
attrs.info: defines position on TrackEdge

attrs.name: reversalTime
attrs.info: Defines the time in seconds to switch from one position to the other ; 0 means unknown

attrs.name: derailToRight
attrs.info: if false = derailToLeft, the side at which the train will be derailed

structs.name: Crossing
structs.info: Defines the physical track asset Crossing without possibility to switch between two track edges

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: trackEdgePoints
attrs.info: composes of track edge points

attrs.name: isSwitchable
attrs.info: True: If the crossing is switchable ; False: If the crossing is not switchable ;https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Switched_diamond_crossings

structs.name: BaliseGroup
structs.info: Defines a group of balises.

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: nid_bg
attrs.info: national identifier of the balise group

attrs.name: nid_c
attrs.info: country identifier of the balise group

attrs.name: balises
attrs.info: Defines the balises within the balise group. ETCS-positionInGroup is equal to the position this array

attrs.name: bgFunction
attrs.info: to be clarified, if derivable from baliseTelegram

attrs.name: linkOrientationDirection
attrs.info: defines linking orientation direction along the TrackEdge

structs.name: Balise
structs.info: Defines a balise.

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: spotLocation
attrs.info: location on TrackEdge

structs.name: PropertiesArea
structs.info: the object itself contains default-values for the area. Exceptions are in trackConditions etc.

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: versionTimestamp
attrs.info: version information which is valid since timestamp

attrs.name: gauge
attrs.info: default gauge in the area. Deviations are covered in trackEdgeGauges

attrs.name: loadingGaugeTypes
attrs.info: list of supported loading gauges per default

attrs.name: defaultVoltage
attrs.info: defines default Voltage

attrs.name: defaultMaxCurrent
attrs.info: used in ATO & ETCS.packet40

attrs.name: permittedBrakingDistances

attrs.name: tractionSystems

structs.name: TrackEdgeGauge
structs.info: inner distance between two rails, e.g. 1432 for EU-standard-rails

attrs.name: gauge
attrs.info: defines different track gauges

attrs.name: trackEdgeSections
attrs.info: composes of track edge sections

attrs.name: loadingGaugeType
attrs.info: defines different loafing gauges

structs.name: TrackCondition
structs.info: Defines the TrackConditions for a section of track

attrs.name: trackEdgeSections
attrs.info: composes of track edge sections

attrs.name: conditionType
attrs.info: defines different track conditions

structs.name: CurrentLimitation
structs.info: Defines max current for a list of track sections

attrs.name: trackEdgeSections
attrs.info: composes of track edge sections

attrs.name: maxCurrent
attrs.info: defines max current value

structs.name: PermittedBrakingDistance
structs.info: Defines max allowed braking distance for a list of track sections

attrs.name: trackEdgeSections
attrs.info: composes of track edge sections

attrs.name: distance
attrs.info: defines the applicable permitted braking distance

attrs.name: brakeType
attrs.info: defines the applicable brake type for braking

attrs.name: gradientValue
attrs.info: defines the gradient associated with the permitted braking distance

attrs.name: sameDir
attrs.info: usage direction of the TrackEdge ;true: active in same direction as trackEdge, false: active in opposite direction

structs.name: TractionSystem
structs.info: Defines the equipped traction system on the track

attrs.name: trackEdgeSections
attrs.info: composes of track edge sections

attrs.name: voltageType
attrs.info: defines the different voltage types

structs.name: TrackUsageArea
structs.info: Preferred usage specification, most usable for TMS and planning

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: versionTimestamp
attrs.info: version information which is valid since timestamp

attrs.name: secondaryTracks
attrs.info: all tracks except 'shuntingTracks' and 'secondaryTracks' are 'mainTracks'

attrs.name: shuntingTracks
attrs.info: all tracks except 'shuntingTracks' and 'secondaryTracks' are 'mainTracks'

attrs.name: preferredSameDir
attrs.info: track edges with preferred direction identical to the TrackEdge-Direction

attrs.name: preferredOppositeDir
attrs.info: track edges with preferred direction opposite to the TrackEdge-Direction

structs.name: TrackEdgeSpeedProfile
structs.info: Defines the permitted speeds for a Track edge in both directions

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: sameDirProfile
attrs.info: speed profile valid in the same direction as the trackEdge

attrs.name: oppositeDirProfile
attrs.info: valid in the opposite direction as the TrackEdge. Skip if the same in both directions.

attrs.info: composes of static speed profiles

attrs.name: axleLoadSpeedProfiles
attrs.info: composes of axle load speed profiles

structs.info: Defines the static speed profile for a section of track

attrs.name: speed
attrs.info: Defines the applicable speed for the section of track ; Resolution min 5 kmph

attrs.name: specificStaticSpeedLimits

structs.name: SpecificStaticSpeedLimit
structs.info: Defines the specific static speed profile for a section of track

attrs.name: speed
attrs.info: Defines the applicablespeed for the section of track ; Resolution min 5 kmph

attrs.name: specificLimitCategory
attrs.info: defines different specific speed limit categories

attrs.name: otherCategoryReplacesCantDeficiencySSP
attrs.info: is of type other Category Replaces Cant Deficiency SSP

attrs.name: otherCategoryDoesNotReplaceCantDeficiencySSP
attrs.info: is of type other Category Replaces Cant Deficiency SSP

attrs.name: cantDeficiencyCategory

structs.info: Defines the axle load speed profile for a section of track

attrs.name: startPos

attrs.name: endPos

attrs.name: speed
attrs.info: Defines the applicablespeed for the section of track ; Resolution min 5 kmph

structs.name: ETCSMarker
structs.info: Defines the ETCS Marker Boards

attrs.name: markerFunctionStop
attrs.info: true=stop, false=location (when the ETCS marker is a location marker)

structs.name: StopLocation
structs.info: Defines the stop locations

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: stopTrainLimit
attrs.info: composes of stop train limits

attrs.name: trainLoadType
attrs.info: composes of train load types

attrs.name: doorOpeningSide
attrs.info: defines different train opening sides

attrs.name: trainMaxLength
attrs.info: use zero if not defined

attrs.name: trainMaxAxles
attrs.info: use zero if not defined

attrs.name: trainMaxWagons
attrs.info: including Locomotives, use zero if not defined

attrs.name: trainMaxSize
attrs.info: use undefinedTrainSize if not defined

structs.name: PlatformEdge
structs.info: Platform for the purpose of RINF is understood as a platform edge. A platform concerns only the part of the structure neighbouring to the track (interfaced with trains).

attrs.name: platformId
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: name
attrs.info: User-friendly name, only if different from id

attrs.name: linearLocation
attrs.info: composes of linked path

attrs.name: stopLocations
attrs.info: add only, if stopLocation can be used on that PlatformEdge for passenger/freight exchange

attrs.name: height
attrs.info: defines different platform heights

structs.name: Platform
structs.info: Defines the container object platform

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: name
attrs.info: User-friendly name, only if different from id

attrs.name: platformEdges
attrs.info: composes of platform edges

structs.name: OperationalPoint
structs.info: An operational point (OP) means any location for train service operations, where train services may begin and end or change route, and where passenger or freight services may be provided; operational point also means any location at boundaries between Member States or infrastructure managers. In https://eur-lex.europa.eu/eli/reg_impl/2019/773/oj 2.1.2 Principal locations (stations, yards, junctions, freight terminals).

attrs.name: uopId
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: opName
attrs.info: User-friendly name, only if different from id

attrs.name: travelTimeMeasurementPoints
attrs.info: used to measure/define timestamps for passing trains. Stopping-timingPoints can be found via platforms.platformEdges.stopLocations and timingPoint.stopLocation

attrs.name: operationalPointType
attrs.info: Defines the type of Operational Point

attrs.name: platforms
attrs.info: the sequence of platforms is according to the real location, so neighbours are the same in array and reality

structs.name: TravelTimeMeasurementPoint
structs.info: normally the passing time through a OperationalPoint is measured at the middle of it

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

structs.name: TimingPoint
structs.info: Defines a fixed point on the infrastructure

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: activeObject
attrs.info: composes of active timing points object

structs.name: TPActiveObject
structs.info: A functional object infront of which a TimingPoint is located and active

attrs.name: etcsMarker
attrs.info: refers to ETCS marker

attrs.name: stopLocation
attrs.info: refers to stop location

attrs.name: timeMeasurePoint
attrs.info: refers to travel time measurement point

structs.name: Tunnel
structs.info: A railway tunnel is an excavation or a construction around the track provided to allow the railway to pass for example higher land, buildings or water.

attrs.name: tunnelIdentification
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: name
attrs.info: User-friendly name, only if different from id

attrs.name: tunnelTubes
attrs.info: composes of tunnel tubes

structs.name: TunnelTube
structs.info: Defines the tunnels tubes within a tunnel. Main Use-Case identify emergency management with rescue into neighbour tube

attrs.name: trackArea
attrs.info: composes of track area

attrs.name: crossSection
attrs.info: for calculation of air-resistance ; Standard Cross section dimensions corresponding to ATO Tunnel types will be defined later
